result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Terrell Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Lab for testing. Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Maintain full-time/part-time employment/schooling/and or vocatinal training.
- Participate in an educational program.
- Work on obtaining a GED/HSED.

- No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
- No to be in possession of any illegal substances without a valid prescription.
- No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.

- Cooperate with Agent.
- Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- AODA assessment with follow-up care and treatment.
- Random urine screens with no positive results.

supervisions.notes: As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition at any time in the future. 941.29 Wisconsin Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1). Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Received, filed and signed. ORDER CONCERNING SENTENCE ADJUSTMENT.  Copies distributed to parties. Deputy Court Clerk: AS.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. spc
Count 1

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 18 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration  NOR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pays shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment / schooling / and or vocational training.
*  Participate in an educational program.
*  Work on obtaining a GED/HSED.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.
*  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Not to be in possession of any illegal substances without a valid prescription.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.
*  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition at any time in the future - 941.29 Wisconsin Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Marcus Terrell Sanders in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Marcus Terrell Sanders in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 44.

Defendant Marcus Terrell Sanders in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Marcus Terrell Sanders in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
